verses.verse: And after six days, Jesus takes along Peter, James, and John (his brother) and brings them up into a high mountain by themselves.
And He was transformed in front of them, and His face shined as the sun. His clothes became white as the light.
And, look, Moses and Elijah were seen by them speaking together with Him.
When Peter responded, he said to Jesus, "Master, it is nice for us to be here. If you want, I will make three tents here, one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah."
As he was still speaking, look, the shadow of an illuminated cloud fell on them, and look, a voice from the cloud, saying, "This is My Son, the loved One, in whom I am pleased. Listen to Him."
And when the students heard it, they fell down on their face and were terribly afraid.
And when Jesus came forward, He touched them and said, "Get up. And don't be afraid."
When they raised their eyes, they saw no one except Jesus alone.
And as they walked down out of the mountain, Jesus demanded them, saying, "You will tell no one of the sighting until the time that the Son of the Person will come back to life from the dead."
And His students asked Him, saying, "So why are the Old Testament transcribers saying that it is necessary for Elijah to come first?"
When Jesus answered, He said to them, "Elijah not only comes and will reestablish all things,
but I tell you that Elijah already came, and they did not recognize him. But they did with him as much as they wanted. This is also how the Son of the Person is going to be suffering under them."
At that time, the students understood that He talked to them about John the Submerger.
And when they came to the crowd, a person came to Him, kneeling before Him and saying,
"Master, show forgiving kindness to my son because he is mentally deranged and suffers badly. You see, many times he falls into the fire and many times into the water.
And I brought him to your students, and they were not able to heal him.
When Jesus responded, He said, "O generation, untrusting and that has been twisted, until when will I be with you? Until when will I tolerate you? Bring him here to Me."
And Jesus forbid it, the demon came out of him, and the boy was healed from that hour.
Then when the students came to Jesus by themselves, they said, "Why weren't we able to throw it out?"

Jesus said to them, "Because of your lack of trust. You see, amen, I tell you, if you have trust as a kernel of mustard, you will state to this mountain, 'Walk from here to there,' it will walk, and nothing will be impossible to you.
But this kind does not travel out except in prayer and a time of going without food.
As they were busy in Galilee, Jesus said to them, "The Son of the Person is going to be turned over to people's hands,
they will kill Him, and He will be gotten up on the third day." And they were terribly sad.
After they came into Capernaum, the people who take up the double drachmas (the temple tax) came to Peter and said, "Isn't your teacher paying the double drachmas?"

He says, "Yes." And when he went into the house, Jesus already came to him first, saying, "How does it seem to you, Simon? The kings of the earth, from whom do they take taxes or enrollment? From their sons, or from the ones belonging to others?"
Peter said to Him, "From the ones belonging to others." Jesus was declaring to him, "Clearly the sons are definitely free.

But so that we won't trip them up, after you travel to the sea, throw a hook in, and pick up the fish that tumbles up first. And when you open its mouth, you will find a stater (a silver coin). After taking that, give it to them for Me and you."
